column4: Anyone have time to help me ASAP? My system says "An error occurred while mounting" when i try to boot
last thing i remember doing was mounting a ftp through nautilus
looks like something happened to fstab
my fstab looks normal
syays though UIID=45058d9d-4ef2-4ccf-b587-0eba53e61d06 / ext4 error=remount -ro 0 1
says though *
error=remount. so it wont let you pass without mounting?
yes that drive is where my filesystem is on
ah. is it UIID or UUID?
In my fstab it says UUID
think that UUID is correct
are you on the machine?
i have booted from livecd and mounted the filesystem so i can edit the files
i have irc on another computer so if you have any suggestions i can run them on my machine
sorry im impatient, think you can help me out?
im in a pinch here :)
i don't think i'll be able to help, but someone else may be able to
ok
can i run nautilus from a mounted filesystem?
all i can think of is using "sudo fdisk -l" and verifying some data
it all happed after i tried to mount a ftp drive through nautilus (i think thats the source of evil anyways)
maybe i need to unmount that drive, thats why im asking if i can run nautilus from a mounted filesystem
